numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some young people reach out to their parents at least once a week.
2. Among these young people, young women reach out to their parents more than young men.
3. Young women send texts to a parent almost 25% more than young men send texts to a parent.
4. Young people sometimes visit a parent in person.
5. The gap between young men and young women is smaller for visiting a parent in person.
6. According to the visual, young women are more likely than young men to reach out to a parent.
7. This is true no matter how they reach out.
8. The people were surveyed in some country.
9. I wonder how the visual would change if the surveyed country changes.
10. In some countries, it is common that people stay closely connected with family.
11. I want to see how the results differ around the world.
12. I wonder what the graphic would look like for an older age group such as 35-40.
13. Mothers sometimes reach out to their kids.
14. Fathers sometimes reach out to their kids.
15. I wonder how frequently mothers reach out to their kids.
16. I wonder how frequently fathers reach out to their kids.
17. I wonder if some gaps in the visual would be the same for mothers and fathers.
18. I am a college student.
19. I think that it is important that I reach out to my parents frequently.
20. People in this age range can be busy.
21. If people in this age range are busy, then it is hard for them to reach out to a parent frequently.
22. Seeing a parent in person is a way to reach out to a parent.
23. If people in this age range are busy, then it is especially hard for them to see a parent in person.
24. The headline could be: Staying in touch: Why do young women seem to do it more frequently?
